revised_title: Experimental Treatment of Trypanosomiasis: Lithium Antimonyl Tartrate as a Cure
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to find an effective treatment for trypanosomiasis, a disease affecting animals. They discovered that lithium antimonyl tartrate was an effective cure when administered subcutaneously. This treatment eliminated the trypanosomes from the blood and prevented recurrence of the disease. The authors also tested other antimony compounds, but found them less effective than lithium antimonyl tartrate.
